Reviews.Title: “Well placed walking distance or tram, Good for Families!”
Reviews.Author: OZ_Family_Abroad
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 (2 adults and a 4 & 5 yr old) we had a great stay in this hotel. The service was great and the location was within walking distance of main shopping areas and down town. If you did not want to walk far you could catch the tram from down the road. The room was fantastic, very clean and modern inside the room for an older style building in Amsterdam. The Room we had was the ONLY "Family Room" in the hotel (I was told) that slept 4 people with two good sized single beds pushed together to make a Queen sized bed on either side of the room (so 2x Queen sized beds) with a Flat screen TV up on the wall at the foot of the bed. We also had a desk area up near the beds and a good sized bathroom with separate bath and shower with the toilet separately located around the corner. Plus a separate sitting area for 4 people and another flat screen TV. near the Tea and Coffee making facilities. The Wardrobe was the buildings original big old walk in safe that had been converted into a walk in robe, with in room safe in there too. The only downside to this extra large family room was the fact that it was the only room downstairs from reception (in the basement area) but the room did have a large sky light window that had an automatic blind to close it off at night. But I would have gladly forgone any views from upper floors to have this type of space in a European hotel room. You can easily stay in this room for a week or more and not feel too squashed as the room was sectioned of into a sleeping area, hallway and sitting area, like a small apartment rather than a normal hotel room. Very good price booked through Octopus Travel online for around 100 euros per night. Breakfast was served in the hotel (included in the price) and was eggs, bacon, breads, pastries and cereals etc. which is always a bonus when included in the price. I can only comment on the size of our room as I did not see the regular rooms, but if travelling with lots of luggage there is a lift that you can take the one floor down, but it does lead through the "Back of House" but after we took our luggage to our room via the lift, we used the stairs every other time, that were just outside our room that lead straight to the reception desk. The room was great the beds were very comfortable and we would stay here again (in that downstairs family room) and would recommend this place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: NiamhyN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is based in a lovely area near the museum quarter. The location is great and we walked everywhere from it, however it is not a 4* hotel. The staff are lovely, really helpful and friendly but the rooms and some of the decor is quite dated. All in all, i'd recommend the hotel as a 3* but a really nice one at that

Reviews.Title: “Ideal small hotel near to museums and easy reach of city centre”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the Memphis hotel. It is a city hotel that is both small but modern for those who wish some comfort but do not intend to spend hours each day in the hotel, therefore there is no spa/pool/gym etc, but the rooms are adequate sized for a double or twin beds and have the necessary comforts and on suite shower/bath facilities. Breakfast is certainly worth considering as the selection is both Continental and English and it certainly sets you up for the day. The hotel location we found perfect as you are only 5 minutes from the central attractions on the No16 tram or the No2 via a 5 minute walk. Also handy is the airport shuttle bus stops outside the concert hall on the same street (a 4 Euro fare ride from Schipol airport) Last time we stayed at the Wyndam Apollo which ok is 4* all over, but for a city break for sightseeing not business then we would stay at the Memphis again - no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVEL125
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat nervous about staying here after reading some of the past reviews, but when I got here I was pleasantly surprised. This is a small boutique hotel, which is centrally located and easily assessable to public transportation. The selling point here is the GREAT staff, which was very friendly and helpful. They gave me tips on transportation, places to go, food and overall things to do in Amsterdam. I called the hotel a couple of times because I got lost in Amsterdam to get directions and they were very helpful. One night, I came into the hotel, right as the restaurant was closing. I asked if they were still open, they informed me they were not. The chef/cook was coming from the back as I was talking to the host. He asked me what would you like. I said well you are closing, he than said no I will cook something for you. What would you like, I said, â€œI don't know " He asked if I liked chicken, I said yes. He than went and cooked me a piece of grilled chicken and made a salad. I was so appreciative of this because he was not required to do this. I would definitely recommend this hotel because the staff makes up for what may be lacking in the rooms. Donâ€™t get me wrong the rooms are ok but I was just not prepared to sleep in a single bed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent experience, Although not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: 1988abhishek
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised when we saw the hotel form the exteriors as it did not potray whata 4* hotel would seem to be like. On arrival, the receptionist was very courteous and helped us with check in and also showed us on map touristy places as well. What I din't find comfortable in the rooms was that the air conditioning was not switched on although our rooms were pre-booked. The heat (it was summer) was intense and we had to open our windows for almost an hour to get the heat out. Furthermore, the internet wifi was very very slow. When contacted the reception all they could offer was to use an old machine in their business center which was a fixed internet connection, and apparently faster. Also the bathrooms don't have latches. So, if you are sharing rooms with business associates, you may want to reconsider. Excellent breakfast, with good variety to offer. Courteous staff at restaurant. bar and reception. Good house keeping services as well. All in all, would reccommend for single persons or couples or families. Would think again if you are on business, as the internet was really a problem for me !

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our tour group.”
Reviews.Author: OneCageyTraveler
Reviews.Content: A group I toured with stayed at the Memphis recently. I have to say we found the location to be great (right on the #16 tram line into the central district and all the main attractions) and with several nice little local type restaurants and shops within several blocks walk. I found the room to be clean and well serviced, the bed comfy, the wireless internet was free (for a change), and the front desk staff was very helpful and provided excellent service. The only thing I felt could be changed was the heat in the room. We were on the 4th floor, and since heat rises, the room was hard to cool down. We had the windows open overnight in Dec to keep it comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but not exciting!”
Reviews.Author: experience_addicted
Reviews.Content: First stay in Amsterdam (Lovely place) and hotel in a very good spot with only 10 minutes to central town and all there is to see. However, room very, very small, not possible to open window as large busy road and staff did not change bed for our four day stay (first time for me!). Otherwise ok as clean room, reasonable breakfast and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dr_Geoff
Reviews.Content: I have to disclose my bias by saying that I have been coming to this hotel for well over a dozen years. I can't even remember how long. I've been through a couple of changes of management/ownership and am happy to say that the Memphis has weathered the storms well. I am on a first name basis with most of the staff and many of them have been with the hotel for as long as I have been coming as a guest. And, when I come, I stay for at least a week. So, I do know my way around this hotel. The Memphis is a four star hotel and has the corresponding amenities. So, I'm not going to go down the list of what you would expect to find here. You will. The breakfast is very good as well as the bar. Just this past year they have made the breakfast room into a full service restaurant open for lunch and dinner. I haven't had a chance to sample it for anything but breakfast, but friends say it is good. Anything you might want in a fine hotel is to be found here. I teach a yearly seminar in Amsterdam and we started using this hotel because of a reasonably-priced conference room in addition to reasonably-priced rooms. Now, there are two features that keep me coming back - staff and location. The hotel staff is as professional and friendly as you will ever find. They are multilingual and can handle anything you throw at them. I am multilingual myself and attest that they do a fine job. They have always gone out of their way to serve us in any way. On my most recent trip, my assistant rented a bicycle at the hotel to experience the unique feel of Amsterdam. Seeing her struggle to get comfortable with hi bike, the head chef ran out to help and ended up taking her and her friends on a brief tour of the neighborhood. Typical Memphis staff! The second feature this hotel has going for it is location, in the museum quarter right at the intersection of De Lairessestraat and Cornelius Schuyt Straat, a well-known, upscale shopping street with restaurants good for celebrity watching. You are an easy walk from the three big museums and the Concertgebouw. Tram 16 goes right by the hotel and Tram 2 is two blocks down Cornelius Schuyt Straat. I LOVE this neighborhood!!! You are well-removed from the craziness of tourists in the red light districts and some of the more seedy parts of town. You could stay at the nearby Hilton, of course. But why would you want to do that when the Memphis is so, so gezellig!.

Reviews.Title: “Memphis in good neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: CroydonPixy
Reviews.Content: The Memphis was a comfortable hotel. We liked the size of the room if it was a little on the warm side but there is air conditioning if you want it. There is quite alot of traffic and I found it difficult to sleep although my partner had no trouble. The room is also well lit for reading with a handy fridge and a great TV with BBC channels . We found the staff helpful and friendly ( I had to get my pillow replaced as I'm allergic to feathers and this was done with a smile) Beds are very comfortable.The room was clean and the shower did the job. The location is good with the 16 Tram route taking you into the centre of Amsterdam in 15mins and an easy walk to Museumplein. We found a great place for breakfast at Bagels and Beans just opposite the Albert Cuypstraat tram stop. We didn't eat nearby or at the hotel as they all seemed a bit expensive to us. We would recommend the city pass that you can buy at the Tourist information centre if you want to visit some of the excellent museums because this also includes a tram/bus pass. We are good walkers but used the tram a lot and if you pay by the hour it is 2.60 Euros a time. All in all we were very happy with our choice and felt very relaxed and at home at the Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvelous”
Reviews.Author: krashtest d
Reviews.Content: Great area, lovely people, warm atmosphere. I was here for almost 2 weeks, and couldn't have been more pleased. Particularly the 5th floor rooms, very nice. Extremely clean, in true Dutch fashion. In fact, I only have two negatives - first, the female breakfast server on weekends is downright unfriendly, in sharp contrast to the weekday servers. Second, this sounds absurd, but the toilet paper this hotel uses is really awful, just very cheap stuff, surprising in a four star hotel that's otherwise fantastic. Great area too. 15 minute walk to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums. And there's a terrific little Indonesian "Rijstaffel" place nearby, ask at the front desk, very reasonable. Be forewarned, the area around this hotel is wonderful but one of the most expensive in Amsterdam. If you're smart, you'll walk the 10 minutes to the street of the Concertgebouw and eat somewhere there.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crepes2
Reviews.Content: I was forced to move room at about midnight as there was a strange and repetitive noise coming from the chimney. Apparently this is a common complaint with this room. I was told a taxi would be cheaper than a train to the airport. This is probably true but the taxi they booked me vastly overcharged me.

Reviews.Title: “Location, friendliness and fabulous food”
Reviews.Author: SSChester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far enough away from the centre of Amsterdam in a great residential area (with lovely shops, bars and restautrants close by) but is also on the tram route, so no problem getting to wherever you want to with the greatest of ease. The hotel staff are incredibly friendly, exceptionally helpful and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are bright and airy and very comfortable. We were delighted with everything and on our last evening, decided to stay in and eat in the Brasserrie Lairesse in the hotel. It was absolutely brilliant! Made us wish we'd eaten in the hotel every night of our 6 day stay. The staff were wonderful, the food to die for and the wine list a novelty (must be seen to be believed...) Bravo Memphis - you have a great team, a lovely hotel and a superb restaurant. We can't fault anything from our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Review Only”
Reviews.Author: ynysygwas
Reviews.Content: We were staying in another hotel around the corner and called in the Brasserrie Lairesse inside the Memphis to get away from the noise! Felt obliged to give it some brownie points because the food was so good. Superb starters and steak main courses, nice pudding, coffee, bottle of Chablis. 112 euros for two people. (The Chablis, bottle of water and coffees made up 40+ of the bill) The standard of cooking was top class and the service excellent. I'd be tempted to stay here just to be able to pop down to the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LpatCO
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is lovely with several restaurants that were excellent and a variety of shops. Very conveniently located to the trams which is the best way to get around the city. The hotel staff was very nice. The room could use a little TLC (stained grout and ceiling in the bathroom) and they don't provide shampoo and conditioner bottles like you typically get at a hotel But they did have a shampoo/body wash dispenser in the shower. Breakfast was pretty basic but perfectly fine and it was very nice to have a little bar in the hotel lobby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve 4 stars - too run down for that”
Reviews.Author: Hannemor
Reviews.Content: First off all, I had expected more from a 4 star hotel. The hotel is old and the rooms are run down. Also, the room had a weird smell and was not exactly generous in size. I found the location to be too far away from downtown as you have to take a tram wherever you go. Positives: - Extremely friendly staff - Clean rooms Negatives: - Far away from Amsterdam Center - Room smelled weird - Small rooms - Old rooms - Poor toiletries

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: aucdoha
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel but was very pleasantly surprised. The people at the front desk were very helpful in giving me information and advice. I didn't notice any problems with the cleanliness of the room or the bathrooms. I really liked the location outside the city center and near Vondelpark. Two tramlines located nearby to get you anywhere in the city. Its in a very quiet and peaceful area especially at night. The only problem I had with room were the pillows. I did not think they were comfortable but this did not prevent me from getting a good nights rest. Considering the price I thought this hotel was very good and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “For sure stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon in Aug 2011. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. They suggested nice places to visit for eating, shopping and seeing. They also helped us get a van to the airport when our stay was over. The hotel itself was nice, although the room was a bit small. It did have a good sized bathroom however and good a/c. It was located in a quieter, safe-feeling neighborhood about a five minute walk from the Museum District. It was perfect to be just a little bit away from the busier streets and tons of people.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but good location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: anna m
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week. If you find a good offer, and are willing to settle for a 3* hotel it could be a good choice for you. With that said, on the possitive side, the tramway is very close and will get you within 10 min to the city center or to the museumplein,the neiborhood is safe, the staff is polite, breakfast is basic but ok and the beds comfortable.On the other hand, the carpet needs imediate stripping or deep cleaning, the bathrooms need renovating (shower curtains dirty and falling on our heads, problems turning the taps) and the standart bedrooms feel a little cramped...

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: brynmorc
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay-very friendly and helpful staff, very comfortable rooms(if a little warm) and a good breakfast Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bfc2406
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for three nights in the Memphis recently and was very impressed with it. Although a little way out of the tourist areas it was a 2min walk from the tram stops, which ran frequently.(tram 16 or 2) taking you wherever you needed to go around Amsterdam in ten mins max. The hotel itself was in an up Market area of Amsterdam and was in walking distance of local coffee shops and lovely restaurants. Hotel itself was great. Friendly staff, clean modern rooms, free wifi which worked well and an enjoyable breakfast too. We would most certainly stay in the hotel again .

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? Must be joking...”
Reviews.Author: Shebozgur
Reviews.Content: We are only here for 4 days and we don't mind that it's outside the city center since it's right on the tram line. However, when we first arrivef we were dying of thirst and tgere was noone to either welcome or serve us drinks. The double rooms are so tiny that it is impossible to move in it. There was nothing in the mini bar except water and the staff is so ride that they can knock on your door even if there is a do not disturb sign on it just because they suscept that someone is smoking on that floor. I've stayed in other 4 star hotels in different parts of the world but this was the worst in terms of staff, service, size and food. Stay in a tent in amsterdam but never go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: oldjudge
Reviews.Content: In finding rooms for my wife and I and another couple, one would think that the Super Bowl was in Amsterdam during the 3rd week of April. Anything suitable in the central area was sky high and I couldn't figure public transportation sufficient to chance it in most outlying areas (the Amsterdam metro website is the worst I have encountered). I finally compromised on a hotel with mixed reviews and was expecting a small hotel with basic accomodations on the outskirts of downtown whose only saving grace was that it was on the tram line to the central station. Of the 5 hotels I booked for a 2 1/2 weeks trip, I was most concerned about this one. I was pleasantly surprised to find a very nice boutique hotel with a helpful staff, a gourmet restataurant and bar, and a free internet in the business center (OK, an old, slow HP with no printer but, except for the other couple, I had no competition for using it). Our room was tiny and the shower was designed for someone 100 pounds lighter but it was clean and the beds comfortable. It even had drawers so we could take our clothes out of the suitcase. Our friends had a somewhat larger room which was on the street side and no complaints. The neighborhood was fairly upscale with several restaurants and markets within about 3 blocks. Christie's Auction house was across the street and even had a cocktail party the night before we left for home. We considered inviting ourselves but I was afraid that being on the 8th day in the same jeans would be a dead giveaway. The inbound tram stops about 2 blocks away in the direction of downtown and the outbound stops about a block past the hotel. Travel time to the station and back is about 15 minutes one way. We were able to transfer to an intersecting line the only times that we were coming or going anywhere except the station or Dam Square. We asked about the best way to get the 4 of us to the airport and were told by the staff that the standard fare was 35E for the taxi and it took about 25 minutes. They ordered a taxi suitable for 4 people with substantial luggage and he arrived just ahead of schedule with a van that would have handled 2 more people and we were at the airport in barely 15 minutes at 7 am on a weekday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Miniature, overheated room - not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: SusanneCH
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel because it was walking distance to my business location and affordable for a 4 star. The room was miniscule and overheated; but clean. Tried opening the windows, but then it was just too loud to sleep. Had wireless access for free in the room. Woke up atleast 4 times during the night, other guests who came back in the morning hours talked in the hallway and you can hear every word. Service in the restaurant was unfriendly. Being a woman and travelling alone I was more comfortable sitting at the side of the room -but the table was for 3. I was asked to move to another table; with much more exposure. The restaurant did not fill (I came in at 9 pm) - and my preferred table remained empty. Food was ok. Had a chicken soup which was rather watery (alot of veggies, hardly any chicken). The salad with goat cheese was quite nice. Breakfast buffet is ok; but again unfriendly service (different people than the evening before).

Reviews.Title: “very friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: sakis13
Reviews.Content: a hotel that i stayed 1 year ago! really polite staff,warm and clean room! very easy to communicate with the centre as there is a tram stop few metres away!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: EricOOOO
Reviews.Content: Our room was quiet, clean and roomy. Breakfast was very good. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: alinaderzad
Reviews.Content: This is a very decent hotel, a little bit out of the way (but the tramway stop is just a stone's throw away). The only off-putting thing is the front staff--to say that they were unpleasant and unresponsive is an understatement. We were new in town, had only three days to visit a lot of the sights and needed some assistance. We asked a few questions and wondered we should continue, given the stone-cold expression on the woman at the reception (a blond)..I wondered if it's only her, but noticed it's everyone at the counter. I was quite put off by that. Also, it's annoying that breakfast was not included, but then that's becoming the norm even with larger hotels. In general, this is a recommendable hotel. but don't be too surprised by the attitude. Anyway, the Dutch are not super pleasant as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: traveller5936
Reviews.Content: We were offered a free upgrade but after we had unpacked we found there was no water in bathroom.The receptionist said she had not been informed(perhaps a lack of communication).The room we finally finished up in was very clean and comfortable.The breakfast was certainly adequate with quite a good variety of continental and bacon,scrambled egg etc. It was located in a very pleasant street and we found a good restaurant nearby.Tram stop was close by and we were in centre within 10 minutes. One receptionist was pleasant but the other one rather brusque and didn't stop her chat when I was waiting to be served. However we found the Dutch to be very pleasant and willing to help. What a lovely city!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own barman or you may die of thirst.”
Reviews.Author: T0nyEgan
Reviews.Content: Pro's Excellent location, near museums and a tram outside to the city centre, as quite as you'll get, the rooms were clean and large enough but very hot. The staff were friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast was substantial but the machine dispensing a range of fresh ground coffee was a great success with me. Con's Every single time we wanted a drink we had to ask the receptionist to find the barman, even when we had some Dutch friends visiting we had to walk inside to the reception desk every time we wanted another round of drinks, extremely annoying. Our room on the 5th floor was unbearably hot even with the air conditioning working full time, we spent five nights sleeping on top of the covers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't mind the walk”
Reviews.Author: forbestom
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size and stylish, the staff was cordial. The only downside is that its a hike from a lot of the main attractions. Then again its only a 5-10 minute walk to the Van Gogh and Rijkmuseums. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable, in a quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: simonap967
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious too having read some of the reviews but I was very satisfied with my choice. The Hotel is close to Museumplein and the Concert Hall, in a very quiet location. Staff were friendly. We stayed 3 nights, our room was large: one double bed, a closet, one desk with chair, two armchairs and a coffee table. Breakfast was good, with hot buffet, fresh fruit, many kind of bread, butter, jam, milk, corn flakes, and a good espresso-cappuccino machine. We had dinner in the Brasserie twice, the quality of food is high, and service is very good as well. Definitely it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Functional”
Reviews.Author: Missmay1
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious having read some of the reviews of this hotel - however was more then pleasently surpirsed! It is just out of the town centre on the 16 tram line so easy to get to from Central Station. First impressions - it's a smart hotel, which is always good. Reception staff where friendly enough during check-in although some didn't seem so friendly for the duration of the stay. We had a room right at the top of the hotel, plenty big enough, fresh decor (apart from the bathroom which could do with a tidy up). Bed was very comfortable. Location wise, it can't be faulted there is a parade a shops within a 5 mintue walk, and plenty of choices of restaurants close by. It's a short walk to the Van Gough Museum and Vondel park. Breakfast was a disappointment, but think this was just a presentational thing rather then choice - it's a hot buffet so can look a little past it's best. We had a couple of drinks in the bar, service was a little slow (apart from the first evening when the female waitress was spot on).

Reviews.Title: “Just NOT a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BW41
Reviews.Content: We were shocked to come across this supposed 4* hotel where the carpetsand, baths were grubby and badly stained and worn and the rooms small, and cheaply furnished. Location was indifferent .Staff did try to help but this hotel offers nothing of any comfort, distinction or style. If you look for any more than bare functiionality then look elsewhere. It was so awful we checked out immediately although not until sampling an indifferent breakfast .Truly dire and realy depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Memphis Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Emappeal
Reviews.Content: Quiet setting, convenient to Museums and easy to catch trams to other neighborhoods. Comfortable bed and good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: honkiehoteler
Reviews.Content: Generally a great hotel. Small and cosy and certainly worth the 4 stars. Helpfull staff and reasonable prices breakfast. Internet included and though a bit out of centre of Amsterdam, a tram/bus stop is very close and parking a car is relatively easy (though, Amsterdam like, expensive). Too bad this hotel doesn't have a gym anymore (they used to have a small one but converted that into a business room), with that it would be my ideal choice in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Average ...”
Reviews.Author: LikaFrance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights. The check-in was ok and a man from the hotel helped me to carry my luggage to my room. The room was small if I compare with other hotels but it was ok. I couldn't open the window hence the view was on a busy street so I had to keep it closed however the room had a air conditionning system. The hotel is very close to a tram station and you can walk to the museum district. However the centre is not at a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Huge let down. NOT a full-service hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mjthetraveler
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The mouse in my room that woke my in the middle of the night by rapping and tapping on my keyboard? They gave me a new room but made me check if it was clean first and naturally offered no help in moving my things. The breakfast order card they never picked up from my door? Not sure how you miss those things. The vast difference between the first and the second room I received? The first was miniscule and the second was giant. Not clear why the difference particularly when they forced me to share the smaller one with a mouse :) The nasty carpets in the lobby and on the front steps? The only good thing they provided was good quality Wi-Fi - I give them credit for that. Other than that, for the money, I highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: wellhellsbelles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my last night of a week-long trip to Europe after having been in other parts of Holland and in Paris, and my stay was very pleasant. I took the tram from Centraal Station (around 3 euros) and it dropped me off about a block away. Taking a taxi would definitely be a complete waste of money! The front desk staff were very polite and helpful, and the check-in was quick. The bellhop was very polite and helped me to my room quickly. The room was small but more than enough for my needs as a solo traveler. Everything was very clean and organized, and it was nicely appointed with a small closet, desk, TV, and nightstand. I had a single room, which had a twin bed, but it was quite comfortable for me. The neighborhood has a few nice cafes and restaurants, and it's a 10 minute tram ride to the central part of the city. Those so inclined could certainly walk to a few of the big sights such as the Heineken brewery. If you think you'll make a few trips, there is a hardware store down the street that sells a "strippenkarten," a pass for 7,60 euros that gets you about 8 rides on the tram or bus. However, the museums are definitely within walking distance. I was in too much of a hurry to stay for breakfast, but it sounded pretty nice, albeit expensive. If you aren't inclined to wander around in pursuit of morning coffee and food, it's probably a good idea. The lobby also had a small business center with free internet and a printer that was free to use. The rooms all have free wi-fi, but you must ask for the access code. Although some have reported that this place isn't friendly toward young people, I had a great experience here and I'm in my mid-20s. I think it's a matter of how you treat people and present yourself. A little courtesy goes a long way!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Dr._Bob_4
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms in the Hotel Amsterdam based on the low rate we were able to get on the Internet. We are very pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the rooms, the service, and the friendliness of the staff. We particularly appreciated being able to get into our rooms before the check in time, something that it important for jet-lagged Americans trying to spend their first day in Europe in Amsterdam. Also, the free high speed internet worked great From looking at the previous reviews the hotel must have changed either their staff or their attitude since last year since everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel was great. The location is a bit out of town, which could be a disadvantage for some people but was an advantage for us since we wanted a quiet place to transact some business. The hotel is just an short walk to the museums and a moderate but pleasant walk to the downtown area. The excellent Amsterdam tram service makes it easy to get back. Taxis in Amsterdam are quite expensive, so I would suggest using the trams if you want to keep within your budget. Also, our rate did not include breakfast, so we skipped the expensive breakfast in the hotel and took advantage of one of the many cafes nearby. Overall, this hotel was a good value and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “in two minds about gresham memphis!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reefo1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner have just returned from a 3 night stay at the gresham memphis. We went on boxing day as a xmas present to each other, which was lush to get away after the stress of xmas. However when we got to Gresham after a 20 euro taxi ride from central station we felt it left a lot to be desired! We had booked the xmas special package which included entry into diamond factory, casino, a welcome drink and a bottle of champagnoise in the room - this was provided. However the manager who was on reception was quite blunt and rude with us because we wanted to pay cash for our stay up front. we had paid a small deposit by credit card wwhen booking on line and owed approx 200 euro, he then wanted another deposit and city tax totalling 290 euro!! I was not pleased - as a young couple on a budget money can be tight and we wernt willing to pay this deposit as we had not known in advance of it! The room was nice, clean and fresh.However the chambermaids came in once during our stay and only replaced items from the mini bar!! didnt replace tea, coffee, toilet roll etc! only things that we had to pay extortianate prices for where replaced! The hotel itself is in a bad location too far away from everything i was very dissapointed with this! 2 phonecalls home cost us 20 euro from the room! ridiculous we were also booked in for a smoking room but we when we arrived found all the rooms to be non smoking! Personally i think this this hotel is not the best the location is poor, staff unfriendly and demanding, service poor, and most definatley everything in it is way over priced. would never return to this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely presented, more for an older clientele”
Reviews.Author: Sasha27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and have to say was a little disappointed, mainly due to the staff. We found the staff pretty unfriendly and felt we was judged because of our youth/appearance (29-31 old enough!). That being said the hotel was nicely presented and clean. The location is ok, a bit out of the centre but easy to travel from/to (tram 16). I would say this hotel is suitable for an older clientele but not for anyone under the age of 30.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: pderrick
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire and got a great rate of 105.00 CAD for 1 night. The hotel is not ideally situated if you want the party life in Amsterdam, but it is very close to both the Van Gough museum, Rijkavik, and Vondel Park. Plus, when you're in Europe and you're young you basically walk every where anyway, or just hop on the tram and you'll be anywhere you wanna be within minutes. Check in was sub par. Staff weren't very friendly but whatever. Room was nice, nothing to write home about. But it was clean and had a comfortable bed. So we were satisfied. All in all a very decent hotel, and for the price we paid we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Gresham is grrrreat!”
Reviews.Author: laughli7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while checking out Amsterdam (before returning home). This hotel is in a fabulous neighborhood!! I booked directly online and got a rate of 77 Euro per night (non smoking room). I won't lie - the basic double room was SMALL. It's a double bed and it takes up pretty much the entire room. But we found it cozy. The bathroom was roomy/modern/and very clean. Besides small, I found everything about the room and hotel to be great. It was so nice to come back here after a day of sight seeing and riding bikes. Another perk is Vondel park is just 5 min. away not to mention quaint shops, markets and restaurants - again, just up the street. (We had a lovely dinner at a place around the corner, Brasserie Senz). All in all - if it's in your budget, stay here! you won't regret it. Especially if you're like us - people who have an appreciation for everything Amsterdam has to offer and all the eclectic people who live and visit there - but would prefer not to be staying in the middle of it 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rowie2
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is away from the centre we found this to be a plus. It meant we could have relative peace and quiet on returning from a busy day sightseeing and also meant we could escape the horrors of the many stag "dos" we encountered that weekend! The trams are excellent (No 16 goes regularly from outside the hotel into the city centre). In fact, the public transport system in general was superb. Don't waste money on a taxi from the airport - get the train instead. It was very cheap and incredibly efficient. Our hotel room was a reasonable size, had plenty of storage space and a good TV (with access to BBC). The bed was very comfortable and queen sized(?). The bathroom was fine - the shower was over the bath and pretty powerful. The tiles could do with regrouting but otherwise it was perfectly adequate. Breakfast was included in our deal and was a buffet with a good choice of hot and cold food. The staff were most helpful and friendly. The only negative aspect for us was that, like most places in Amsterdam, smoking is still allowed in public areas and in some of the rooms. Hence, the smell of smoke or worse, sickly air freshner, pervaded the corridors. In general, it was prefect for our needs. We liked the location; there were some lovely shops and cafes nearby en route to Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL GREAT LOCATION I”
Reviews.Author: JEMSNORFOLK
Reviews.Content: My friends and i have just returned from a long weekend in amsterdam the Hotel wasnt in the centre of everything but it was very easy to pop on a tram and to get to all places you wanted to go. (The number 16 tram takes you all the way to Dam square 1.60 euros and the tram stop is just outside the hotel) The staff at the hotel are all very helpful and know all the information on how to get around. The room was nice and clean, no tea/coffee facilities and breakfast around 20 euros so we had breakfast out most of the time. I had taken a great big towel with me and the maids must of taken it along with all the linen to laundry and when i asked at reception they had a look and couldnt find it and didnt seem to care. ( i wont take a towel next time) apart from that it was a very nice hotel and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac68
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel - yes it doesn't live up to it's star rating but then again a lot of hotels in Europe have the same problem. I loved the location - in a very nice part of Amsterdam away from the hustle and bustle and yet only a short tram ride away. The breakfast was good and buffet style, the waiter on duty was very friendly. This hotel is perfect if you want a bit of peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “3 star lobby on a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnAllen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start and end of a Europe vacation. On the positive, it's in a great location for walking to museums/ restaurants. And the lobby, bar and breakfast were what you would expect from a good hotel. But the rooms and service are what you would expect from a budget hotel-- minimal lighting, worn bedspread/sheets, loose shower head. On our return the A/C wasn't working in any of the rooms and no one was on staff to fix it. (We saw three rooms and stayed two weekends in a row). I don't mind staying in a budget hotel to save some bucks, but for us the Memphis was not priced as a budget hotel. If you can get a internet deal that allows you to pay 2 star prices to stay here, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: cassius_dio
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception is without exeption very unfriendly. The hotel is ok, not very nice, for the price I would expect more. the crappy breakfast costs 20â‚¬. Overall, you get the impression that they are very keen on your money.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure”
Reviews.Author: LondonBritt
Reviews.Content: Typical European business hotel whose clientele I guess are normally on company accounts or cards so expect to be charged for everything including internet access. Staff except manager were great and accomodating but we had a very unpleasant experience with the manager who accused us of lying because a member of his staff had not passed on some important price info agreed with her just after we checked in. Booked 3 non smoking rooms but they bumped us to 1 non smoking and 2 smoking. I am a non smoker and my room smelt so much I had to get them to sanitise it before I could stay in it. There was no notice nor apology for the change or the state of the room. The rooms were otherwise very clean. If you are there on a break hope you do not have any noisy people on your corridor because the walls are thin and the doors bang. The breakfasts are expensive but good. See if you can get a discounted B&B deal - they are worth it. Its location is good if you want somewhere quiet but very easily accessible to the city and especially the museums.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: rocel
Reviews.Content: a large group of us stayed in this hotel, so gained a good overview of the rooms. They were all clean, and service was generally good. However, though all rooms were booked as non-smoking, several were given smoking rooms. One person had to be moved as the room smelt overpoweringly of sewage. The hotel was full, so the guest had to put up with it the 1st night, (No alternative was offered), but was moved first thing the next day. Two of the rooms were so small that one could sit on the bed and touch both walls with outstretched arms. The "good" rooms in this hotel are those talked about in the shining reviews, and if you do get one, I'm sure it's a great place to stay. If not, it's pretty miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Cost-effective and enjoyable choice in a peaceful residential area”
Reviews.Author: JH75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a six-night stay in May at the Gresham-Memphis Hotel. Even though all of our pre-arrival dealings with the hotel were positive, several negative Tripadvisor reviews had caused us some concern. They neednâ€™t have. Though weary from our transatlantic flight when we arrived early morning at the front desk, we were pleased to be welcomed by Linda Denekamp, the reservations manager with whom we had corresponded. She was in person as she had been in her email messages â€“ capable, efficient, upbeat and very helpful. In fact, when weighing the various factors that go into the selection of a hotel (cost-effective comfort, appearance, location, amenities, reputation, et al.), Lindaâ€™s professional graciousness and helpfulness tipped the scale in the Greshamâ€™s favor for us. During our stay, each staff member we encountered was also accommodating and helpful. Our room was not yet ready and Linda suggested that we sit in the pleasant bar just off the lobby, where we enjoyed tea and coffee. She brought over to us some of the paperwork and tourist information we had requested, and in a short while we were handed our key. Our quiet, air-conditioned room with a queen bed was on a high floor and had a nice view of Amsterdam rooftops. The bathroom had been renovated and - yes indeed, as others have reported, the shower water pressure was superb. The room was well-maintained during our stay as were the public areas. The breakfast room had a very fine buffet of hot and cold items ,juices, various breads and pastries, etc. It provided a nice start to each day of busy touring. The staff was pleasant and friendly. Although the tram #16 stop is just up the street from the hotel entrance, we quickly discovered that tram #2 was a better choice for us on most days. Its stop was a short walk away, in the direction of Vondel Park (the â€œCentral Parkâ€� of Amsterdam), through a residential area that had nice shops and several small restaurants. We were very glad we had chosen the Gresham-Memphis and most definitely will return. We are happy to recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* Standard!”
Reviews.Author: irishweaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. It was booked as a birthday surprise for my boyfriend. I came across a "hot deal" on the internet and after trawling through so many hotels in amsterdam I thought that I would pay a little bit extra for this "hot deal", (hoping it might be a room upgrade or something but as it happens it was just a cheaper internet rate which once booked could not be cancelled at any stage). Anyhow the bottom line was that I was willing to pay a little more than initially anticipated to guarantee a nice standard of room in this 4* hotel. When I saw our room I was disgusted - definitely not what was advertised via internet - it was small, old fashioned & dull although the rooms were clean and cleaned on a daily basis. There was the usual overpriced mini-bar which we emptied and re-stocked with our own shop bought necessities for the duration of our stay. The staff were absolutely lovely - the barman was great craic!..although the bar itself lacked atmosphere. Breakfast was not included in our deal and with those prices we certainly had no interest. However, we did eat from the bar menu 3 times in the hotel - 1 - Spag Bol..ordered after the 11pm cut-off so we were very grateful for them to accomodate us and didn't really expect anything to be prepared from scratch. 2 - Coq au vin..we are both convinced every item on the plate was microwaved - it killed me to pay â‚¬17.50 each - awful!! 3 - room service again of burgers & curly frys - again burger appeared microwaved. We were 99% convinced that there was actually no chef on duty with regard to food available on the bar menu. Thankfully, we did locate a gorgeous italian restaurant about 5 mins walk around the corner - and the bonus was that it was great value for money. I would personally be very slow to stay in the Memphis Gresham again. Overall the standard of room and quality of food by no means represented that of a 4* hotel. Way overpriced - and at that I'm even talking the cheaper "hot deal" that we availed of. Anyhow I hope this is of benefit to people.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as i thought!!!”
Reviews.Author: blink182gem
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this Hotel 28th June 07. We came over from Hull on the Ferries and when we got to the centre of Amsterdam we got a Taxi to the hotel as we didnt know when it was!!! The taxt cost us 15 euros as the hotel is far away from the centre. When we got to the hotel the women on the front was very polite and helpful, we got our keys and went to the room and it stunk!!! it smelt like rotten eggs!! obviously we went to see the reception and she said it's always like that and blamed the air con and the streets!!! which one??? anyway it took some convincing for her to change out room but when we did it was a much smaller room then before! If you are going to this hotel make sure you dont get a taxi and get the tram a number 16 as it drops u right outside! you'll save a foutune! it's about 25min on tram and 15 in taxi We also has breakfast in bed and that was gorgeous and charged us an extra 5 euros for bringing it to our room nice hotel but wouldnt go back as miles away from centre

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nids
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back from a weekend break in Amsterdam and absolutely loved the Gresham Memphis both in terms of location of hotel and also for comfort. We felt slightly put off by a few of the reviews before we booked but could honestly say that our experience of both the staff and rooms were nothing but excellent. Nothing was a problem, yes you do have to ask for the tea making facilities and also travel adaptors (which was not a problem) and both were easily forthcoming. The room we had was of a good standard, very clean and peaceful at night - what more could you ask for for such an affordable price. To get into town you can either take the no. 16 tram (just outside the hotel) or take a lovely walk (not too far), if you take a left outside the hotel and carry on walking until you get to the right side of Vondel Park there is the exclusive shopping area of Amsterdam (close to the museums). Absolutely fabulous!! and its also close to the museum and casino (great fun). We've stayed in varying hotels in 'dam - the Radisson, Pulitzer and Jolly Carlton and will certainly be staying in The Gresham Memphis Hotel again. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed thoughts, nice room, extremely rude staff”
Reviews.Author: pookieljhb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through easytobook.com who were rubbish. We booked to stay from last wednesday through to this tues, the rate for each day varied from 80Euros to 150Euros, however on the last night (monday) they were going to charge us 210Euros for Monday night, so we left sunday and found a hotel on the dam for 80Euros - there was no way i was going to pay that. When we arrived it was very late and the check in was all smooth. we took the lift to our room and found it said no smoking in there but had an ashtray - we smoked in there anyway. There is also a mini bar - we just took the water out and stored our own drinks in there. There are tea & coffee making facilities available for free - you just have to ask for it everyday - all the sachets come in a little box. And just keep the kettle in the room. The same goes for an iron - just ask. The towells are really worn so take your own, i have to say this hotel has the best shower i have ever used! mega power shower. The food in the hotel is overpriced and disgusting- my partner had a childs portion of spag bol for 12.50 and i had a burger and curly fries- i didnt eat it and complained and the waiter (a young indian guy with glasses) said i shouldnt complain and nobody ever had before, he said it must be me & that id still have to pay for it. My partner went mental, the waiter was so rude we were gobsmacked! The receptionist (with long blonde hair) overheard us complaining and instead of helping lit up a cigarette with her back to us. When we were checking out they said we'd drank stuff out of the minibar, but we asked them to check it and they apologised for the mistake. One day we wanted a lie in so put the do not disturb sign on the door and the maid still knocked the door, we said we'd be 20 mins and they knocked again another 2 times. Our room was fine - the equivilent to a novotel, travel lodge or an ibis in england. It was just the manner of the staff which i found was a real let down, you just get the vibe that they dont want to help you. They could do with a few lessons in customer service! The location was fine though, there are so many trams in amsterdam! To get to/from there to the central station/dam it's number 16 or 2 tram AND 1.60 Per person. But it only took us 30 mins to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: CairoD
Reviews.Content: If you had asked me my opinion of this hotel during my first 36 hours there it would have been overwhelmingly negative. I arrived about 6:30 pm and was given a beautiful room, though it was non-smoking and I had requested smoking. The reception was polite if not apologetic. The next morning I attempted to resolve it and this member of staff treated me with restrained contempt. During the course of my stay her attitude improved, but as we all know first impressions are important. Anyway, five hours later they got me moved. The second room was nice and roomy enough, though not as nice as the first room. If you are a non-smoker, definitely request room 504, very nice, just like the pictures on the website. As I had to cancel the last night of my stay, was told I would have to do it through Easytobook.com where I made my res. This appears to be their official booking agent. Although I resolved the issue, it took me far more time than it should have, 3 days from my first attempt. Cancellation policy is 24 hours, but read the fine print and plan on 48+ hours to be safe if you need to cancel. Book directly with the hotel if you can get a good rate. My stay varied from 84 euro per night to 136 euro per night. I would not pay more than 100 euro per night on a repeat visit. Breakfast is VERY expensive for this class of hotel, 20 euro, as well as the DSL and wireless internet; 24 euro per day if I recall. Beds moderately comfortable, and pillows are great. Towels are sub-standard and well worn. Bring hair conditioner and face cloth if you use them. Both hair dryers were inadequate, again, bring your own. TV selection very good. Housekeeping very good though the first room I was not impressed with the hair in the bathroom; it happens. Coffee from the bar is fantastic , 2 euro each; there are no coffee making facilities in room. No ironing facilities in room. If you like being outside the hustle and bustle of the city center, but just 10 minutes away by tram, this location is great. Near museums for tourists and not far from Rai center for business travelers. Tram is 3 minute walk. On my next visit to Amsterdam I will look for a hotel in this area, maybe even stay at this one again if I cant find another. Most hotel staff need hospitality courses would be my main observation. I spend at least 75-100 nights per year in hotels, so I have a good idea of what good service is.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becks02
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gresham Memphis early and our bags were taken from us and put into storage; this enabled us to go into Dam Square for a little while until our room was ready. The staff were very helpful and apologetic, even though we were early. The hotel is just next to a little side street which has a lovely handmade chocolate shop and some nice restaurants. This road leads to Vondel Park. You can easily walk to Leidseplein (lots of bars and shops) in about 15 minutes. There is a tram stop a couple of streets up from the hotel which runs straight through Leidseplein, Dam Square/RLD, and up to the centre. Easy acess to main areas. As we checked into the hotel we were asked to leave a 50euro deposit, which we werent expecting, but never-the-less it wasnt a problem. This was just to cover the mini bar...etc. and was refunded if it was left unused. Our room was a satisfactory size, however we were slightly dissapointed with the decoration of the room, a bit old fashioned. We wouldnt have minded had we not read that it had been renovated recently; we assumed this meant the bedrooms also, The bed was comfy and clean, as was the towels and all linen. The bathroom was split into a room with a sink and bath/shower and one with a toilet. They were quite small but the tiles and decor was very clean and modern. Our room was cleaned daily, at which we were suprised as we like a lie in until dinner some days. The mini bar was stocked daily and contained about 10 mini bottles of alcohol, beer, water, coke, orange juice, pringles, tobelerone and a few more bits and bats. It was a very well stocked mini fridge. Breakfast was great. Sausage, bacon, egg, ham, cheese, bread, grapefruit, toast, chocolate bread, cereals, fruit cocktail, boiled eggs, fresh fruit... quite a selection really. Unlimited. Overall a great hotel, good value for money and a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Smilingalways
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam many times over the last 20 years, booking hotels from 1 to 5 stars, including the American (reviewed on here a few years ago and the Hotel Maas) I thought this hotel was perfect, great location (5 tram stops from Liedesplien) a quiet and tranquil part of town. The reception area was bright airy and immaculate, the staff upon our arrival were courteous, very friendly and appeared to enjoy what they did. Our room was on the second floor, after having read other reviews which commented on room size, I did not know what to expect. The room was great, good size, king-size bed, good views, large double glazed doors which opened. A spotless bathroom, with the best shower I have ever used. The room was well equipped with satellite TV, good selection of free channels, air conditioning, a trouser press, writing desk and direct dial telephone. Our package included breakfast which was very good, a choice of continental or, surprisingly for Amsterdam, full English! The bar in the Hotel is relaxed with great decor, a very friendly and professional barman who made the evening great fun. A very well polished and comfortable hotel. One which I will book again with no hesitation. Well done Gresham Memphis, you will be seeing more of me.

Reviews.Title: “so sad!!! and could be so good.”
Reviews.Author: enrotue
Reviews.Content: Well, I was certainly mislead by the reviews on TripAdvisor this time........ please do NOT stay here unless you get an amazingly cheap rate (say under 50 Euros for a single). Ok, the staff was wonderful, but the hotel is a disaster in many ways that are almost impossible to fix. My room (which cost 120 Euros without breakfast) was smaller than the closet I had in an nearby hotel last month for less. I could quite literally understand the conversations in the rooms on either side of me. Because of that, I was unable to conduct some business I wanted in the room on the phone since they clearly could understand me too. Also the price of a single phone call was over 1 Euro. I was also a bit surprized by the clients; as I checked in, there were two British 20 somethings trying to check out, but they didn't have enough money to pay the bill! The clerk was the picture of politeness but was firm and showed them on their reservation sheets where the taxes and other fees have NOT been included in the price. Indeed when I checked out I was a bit surprised to find the price was about 20$ a night more than I had expected and I read all the fine print in those things (the difference was blamed on the exchange rate.... right....) So my advice... go in a chat with the nice staff, but don't stay there. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kellyandjason
Reviews.Content: Really exceeding our expectations. Warm and friendly staff who are pleased to help. The hustle and bustle of the nightlife is only a short tram/taxi ride away. So its in an ideal location if you don't want to be in the centre of it all. Would highly recommend and will be going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: EnglandOnTour
Reviews.Content: Well i have just arrived back in my home in england and i had to write a review about this amazing hotel...me and 16 other friends aged 18 and 19 were out for the weekend and our stay in the hotel was absolutely superb the staff are unbelievably friendly Nebin one of the bar staff and also very warm greeter was a brilliant sport he shared jokes with us and we had a really good time...He was very polite in the manner that he spoke and also mustafa he was just the same awesome!! We have already discussed and agreed on going back to amsterdam and without any doubt in our minds we will be staying in the same hotel...the staff we so friendly they told us the best ways to get into town nebin ordered taxis for us and they were there in minutes of putting the phone down. Looking forward to going back already great job everybody at the hotel thankyou for you hospitality it was a brilliant stay. On behalf of the 16 english lads Thankyou Mr. C Bowness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Weedo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 4th and 5th August. Found the hotel staff very very helpful. Our room was lovely. Easy access into Dam Square with the tram being only around the corner. Will definately going back to Amsterdam and will look again at staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vic1971
Reviews.Content: First time that I have booked a hotel via the internet, so I was hoping that the hotel was as nice as it looked and read on the site. Wasn't disapointed at all, lovely hotel for the how much I paid for 3 nights - although cost displayed at the hotel per night seems a bit costly. Nice room, good air conditioning system installed and attentive and helpful staff. Hotel is located 5 mins walk from the Museumplein and very easy to get a tram into the centre. Buy a 48 hour tram ticket - costs 10 Euros well worth the money as 1 way on the tram costs 1.60E, therefore you can just hop and off the trams all day long and explore this wonderful city. Had a great time, would definitely go again and would also stay at the Memphis again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Warks
Reviews.Content: Had a very good internet deal, booked in at 2300hr, no problem with this. The room was large, clean and comfortable, the staff were all very polite and helpful, bag storage on the last day available as we had an evening flight home. A little way from the centre but easily accessed by 1 tram ride or a walk through the park. Would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: debzie
Reviews.Content: The tourist information board booked a room for us in this hotel as we were very unhappy with the hotel we were supposed to be staying in. The area is really nice. Lovely cake shop around the corner. The hotel was happy to hold our bags as our room wasn't ready. (we were too early) There was a fully stocked mini bar, separate toilet to en suite bathroom. The hotel was clean and bright. Getting to and from the hotel really easy using tram 2. Would try to get a deal on the price as it is a little pricy.

Reviews.Title: “An Honest stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From knowing the quality of The Gresham in Dublin I was curious when I discovered there was one in Amsterdam. Got a great deal on expedia, unusual as teachers, my wife and I usually pay big prices in holiday time. I'll keep this short. Good stop but certainly no Gresham in Dublin. But this should'nt put you off. Its a great location don't understand other reviews about too far out, or doesn't suit those who want to parade the coffee shops. Its a great location...yes about 7-10 mins out from the Dam....but whats wrong with that? Quiet, upmarket area. Always use tram 2 which is a 5mins walk outside the hotel. This tram takes you past the main spots so you can get out at what ever time you want. Tram costs 1E 60 however at night and sometimes during the day we did'nt pay.(Naughty!!) Oh! Last tram leaves the Dam at 11.15pm otherwise a taxi is available at Â£7. The Hotel is grand as we say in the north of Ireland which means not too bad. The room which is not the superior room is small, comfortable but has a small bathroom and tiny seperate toilet. But as my wife says,"as long as the sheets are clean" and cleaned each day. In conclusion...walking distance to Van Gough and other gallery's, clean room, friendly staff.....good choice if you get a good deal. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Misery - You can't judge a book by its cover.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful. The staff is friendly. The rooms appear old. The room decor and comfort does not match the recently renovated feel of the lobby. We spent the first night without A/C. The A/C was broken on our floor. We were also relocated to a single-bed room (for 2 people) because the initial flush of the toilet caused water to cover the bathroom floor. We were told that a rollaway bed was not an option. We later were asked to move rooms 2 more times for a total of 4 rooms across 3 nights. One of the rooms we were moved into had not been cleaned. Room 1: No A/C and Flooded Room 2: Single Bed Room 3: Not Yet Cleaned from the Last Guest Room 4: Finally to a Double-bed Room. They offered us a room at the Hilton for an additional $200 euro per night. The hotel is, in our opinion, nothing close to a 4-star. It has a nice website and a nice lobby and a kind staff, but you just can't judge a book by its cover. (There were no signs of continued renovation into the lodging floors.)

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, lovely area, shame about the plumbing”
Reviews.Author: odders
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and quite stylish, with friendly and efficient staff. It's a little out of the city centre, close to the Vondelpark, the main museums and the Concertgebouw. Great for visitors who want art, culture and music; not for those interested in coffee-shop culture and the 'red-light'. Easy to reach from the central station by public transport (tram 16 is direct, tram 2 to a parallel street about 500m away, many other trams and buses as far as the nearby Museumplein). Central station to hotel is about 20 minutes by tram. Rooms are large and well kept; facilities are ok, although they could do with extractor fans for the bathrooms. The area is quiet at night, but we did get quite a bit of traffic noise in our room at the front of the hotel. It's rather a select neighbourhood. Walk towards the Vondelpark along Cornelis Schuytstraat for a small selection of up-market shops, including organic food and a nice patisserie (and two nice cafes, Van Dam and de Joffers, that serve 5 Euro breakfasts if you don't want the 13-euro hotel option - although non-smokers beware!). The most fashionable shopping street in the city, P C Hoofstraat, is a five-minute walk. Our only real problem was a noisy radiator in the room, which kept us awake most of one night. Staff were sympathetic and maintenance came to fix it next day. Overall, we had a great stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Memphis EMB Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: De Lairessestraat 87, Amsterdam 1071 NX, The Netherlands
